items.question: Is OnePrompt really free?
items.answer: Yes, the app installs free on Mac, Windows, and Linux. It includes free unlimited Web Mode and 10 credits for API Mode. The open source version on GitHub lets you configure your own API keys.

items.question: Is my data safe?
items.answer: Absolutely. Your prompts and responses never leave your device. API keys are stored locally.

items.question: What's the difference between API Mode and Web Mode?
items.answer: API Mode uses the official APIs of AI services. Web Mode uses web interfaces.

items.question: If the app is free, what are the paid credits for?
items.answer: OnePrompt is free in Web Mode, but this mode has natural limitations due to the Terms of Service of AI services. Credits unlock the full power of Cross Check through official APIs: we created a turnkey system to allow even non-developers (who don't have their own API keys) to compare models without restrictions and without complex configurations.

items.question: Can I send one prompt to all AIs at once?
items.answer: To ensure full compliance with AI providers' Terms of Service, the standard edition avoids browser automation, and each prompt requires a few manual clicks. However, an automated edition is available upon request for educational, experimental, and research purposes only. Contact info@one-prompt.app if interested.

intro.title: Introduction
intro.text: Fabio Calabretta ("we", "us", or "our") operates OnePrompt. This Privacy Policy explains how we collect, use, and protect your information when you use our desktop application.

dataCollection.title: Data we collect
dataCollection.text: OnePrompt is designed with privacy as a core principle. The data we may collect depends on how you use the application:
dataCollection.item1: Local data: your prompts, AI responses, and settings are stored locally on your device and never transmitted to our servers.
dataCollection.item2: API keys: if you use your own API keys, they are stored locally and encrypted on your device.
dataCollection.item3: OnePrompt Desktop: if you use OnePrompt Desktop features, we process minimal data necessary to provide the service (authentication tokens, usage metrics for billing).

dataStorage.title: Data storage and security
dataStorage.text: All local data is stored on your device using industry-standard encryption. We do not have access to your locally stored data, including your prompts, responses, or API keys.

thirdParty.title: Third-party services
thirdParty.text: When you use OnePrompt to interact with AI services (ChatGPT, Claude, Gemini, etc.), your prompts are sent directly to those services. Each service has its own privacy policy that governs how they handle your data. We recommend reviewing the privacy policies of the AI services you use.

apiKeys.title: API keys
apiKeys.text: Your API keys are stored locally on your device and are never transmitted to our servers. They are used exclusively to authenticate requests to the respective AI services on your behalf.

proFeatures.title: OnePrompt Desktop features
proFeatures.text: If you use OnePrompt Desktop credits, we collect minimal information necessary to provide the service: your email for account management, payment information processed securely through Stripe, and usage data for billing purposes. We do not store or access your prompts or AI responses.

rights.title: Your rights
rights.text: Under GDPR and applicable data protection laws, you have the right to access, correct, or delete your personal data. Since most data is stored locally on your device, you have direct control over it. For any data related to OnePrompt Desktop purchases, contact us at the address below.
